name: pitifully
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes people feel sympathy: His limbs are pitifully thin, the bones within as fragile as glass. She had survived so much and yet died so pitifully.
in a way that is very bad, unsatisfactory, or not enough: The work is exhausting and pitifully paid. Los Angeles is the most congested city in America, with a pitifully small number of urban parks. See
pitiful
More examplesFewer examplesThe pitifully thin dog desperately needed help.He was so pitifully handicapped it was painful to look at him.The quality of education has deteriorated pitifully.
